pullRequest.title: Feature/3595/service info
pullRequest.bodyText:
There's a lot of properties in that service-info response.
Currently, the create date is our version 1.9.0 release (when we first supported it 2.0.0). The update date is the date the web service was brought up.
At the moment, I have no solution to serializing it as RFC 3339 for this specific endpoint.
TODO: Make tag of that yaml file

nodes.bodyText: Should this mention Dockstore? I could see it other way; as other fields mention it. Depends if this describes the API or the implementation.
Wonder if you shouldn't just link to docs.dockstore.org -- we've talked about tagging doc releases; if we ever do that, it might be better to let the redirect handle the final location.

Should at least be a constant (you have it below). Or, without fully understanding the whole TRS build process as it's integrated with Dockstore, could we derive the version from the openapi.yaml that we build against? I don't know if the version is in there or not. But when we upgrade to 2.0.2, we'll have to remember to update this version.

Yes, it from https://github.com/ga4gh-discovery/ga4gh-service-info/blob/develop/service-info.yaml#L57 I think it is reasonable to say something like "Dockstore is an implementation of the GA4GH Tool Registry API ..."

"First deployed and available"
Don't think it needs to be specifically this version.
Can pick first time we implemented TRS V2 and deployed it
"Last updated" not sure if it means last time the implementation of the API changed or when content changed

Use Maven filtering to auto populate this for auto updates. https://github.com/dockstore/dockstore/blob/develop/dockstore-webservice/src/main/templates/io/dockstore/webservice/resources/Description.java has an example

commit.message: Minor changes, actually set prod/dev, use artifact version

afterCommit.message: Minor changes, actually set prod/dev, use artifact version

nodes.bodyText:
So update date will be when this class is instantiated, probably when the webservice comes up.
As in other comment, this is ok for now but worth checking what they meant this date to be.
